snippet: Aminul Islam, who was found murdered outside Dhaka last week, was a leader who had fought against low wages in the country’s garment industry.
abstract: Murder of Bangladeshi labor activist Aminul Islam in Dhaka marks a morbid turn in the often tense relations between labor groups and the country's extensive garment industry.

byline.original: By JULFIKAR ALI MANIK and VIKAS BAJAJ
byline.contributor: Julfikar Ali Manik reported from Dhaka, and Vikas Bajaj from Mumbai, India. Steven Greenhouse and Stephanie Clifford contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Aminul Islam, who was found murdered outside Dhaka last week, was a leader who had fought against low wages in the country’s garment industry.

headline.seo: Bangladeshi Labor Organizer Is Found Killed
headline.main: Killing of Bangladeshi Labor Organizer Signals an Escalation in Violence
headline.print_headline: Killing of Bangladeshi Labor Organizer Signals an Escalation in Violence

keywords.value: American Federation of Labor-Congress of Industrial Organizations
